lexUnit.name: pounce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: spring or swoop suddenly to catch or as if to catch prey.

sentence.text: The internal leaders may be wondering why he pounced when SWAPO looked likely to be handed power through the ballot box .
The consignment was brought over in the same way and after it was left in a lay-by in Lymm , Cheshire , Customs officers pounced when Scott arrived to collect it .
Any crumbs which fell off the table were pounced on by big bronze lizards -- skinks .
The girl , who was pounced on while waiting for a train at Mexborough , South Yorkshire , was treated in hospital for head wounds .

Any information available soon after a crash is avariciously pounced upon by both journalists and lawyers , and exploited to the full in order that they may derive the maximum benefit for their own particular ends .
Ron had pounced from his car , screeching to a halt ten yards ahead of them .
The gang of four-year-olds had pounced from an entry and were running away , yelling and making faces .
Small vertebrates lurk and pounce in the bushes .
“ James was made to look as though he was waiting in the wings to pounce on his fairytale princess . ”
Instantly an eleven-year-old cousin pounced on her , shielding her from the ball and riding her off .
She said the woman , who lived alone with her father , often feared ` someone was going to pounce on her " .
At least the manager did n't pounce on me just because I shut my eyes for a few moments . "
POLICE are hunting a masked attacker who pounced on a young woman on Saturday night .
Mona and Charity exchanged expressions of incomprehension but pounced on the only word they could understand .
He dashed across the garden and pounced upon the garden gate , pressing the latch with his big feet .
Sometimes he immediately pounced upon whatever I said and showed me in a psychoanalytical way how wrong I was , and how right he was .
He got away from the subject when I pounced upon it .
His body was hairy , muscled , well-shaped , and when I saw him strip for bed he reminded me of a gorilla about to pounce upon its prey .
The thugs pounced as Tony McLoughlin prepared to open up the school shortly after 7am .
The rapist who pounces from behind a hedge is an opportunist .
` Nonsense , Peter , " his wife pounced down on him as if he were a hound that had misbehaved .
It appeared to be an occupational hazard , walking down dark and dingy -- or even brightly lit -- corridors , waiting for strange creatures to pounce out at unexpected moments .
` These are lurking demons waiting to pounce and then you either pack up or reluctantly and sadly sell something off .
If the bird 's head disappears behind some small obstruction , the cat can be seen to rush forward and pounce , as though it knows that at that moment the bird can not see its rapid advance .
When it stopped in a remote area police pounced and arrested the robbers as they off-loaded the cargo .
In the sky above , bat hawks circle , hover and pounce .
The prosecution say that she was plucked from the bridge by Hagans , who 'd lain in wait for the right victim and then pounced .
